data.formatted_address: 257 Ngọc Uyển, TT. Bắc Hà, Bắc Hà, Lào Cai 31300, Vietnam
data.name: Hoang A Tuong Palace

reviews.text:
Something different to experience in Northern Vietnam, interesting to learn the history behind the building.

Currently though there the building is being restored with lost of construction work happening on the building and the surrounding area, I was told the work would last 3 months, not sure when it started though. Technically the building is closed to visitors however it seems it's still possible to enter the complex and look round the ground floor at least, though right now the rooms are all empty. If you want to see it in all its glory wait another month or two.

Hoang A Tuong Palace is a historical landmark in Bac Ha and has a unique blend of European and Chinese architectural styles with intricate decorations and beautiful gardens. It is open to the public as a museum and visitors can also learn about the history and culture of the Hmong people in the region.

Not a must-see, but pretty cool, especially from an architectural side! 20,000k. They’re working on putting more English signage up, but currently only a few are out there. There is a really solid flute shop inside, as well.
The palace is amazing - dont miss it when in Bac Ha. Entry fee was 20k dong
Good place to visit and know more about the history of minority people. Nice piece of art showcase when you can see a local artist makes a indigo fabric.

data.formatted_address: 289 Nguyễn Chí Thanh, TX, Sa Pa, Lào Cai, Vietnam

reviews.text: The shop is not too far away, convenient to O Quy Ho pass. 100,000 VND free drink. Have a view of Fansiapng peak and see the clouds
Good. The pigeons are very friendly. There are many types of flowers. Outdoor seating with a very nice view
Very good and drink is delicious. I got to admire the mountains and forests. And i can see how ethnic people make wine
The shop owner speaks English. Very friendly and guided us to the next places. Very good
I like the quiet and nature. I sat admiring the sky and earth for about 3 hours.

data.formatted_address: Xuân Viên, TT. Sa Pa, Sa Pa, Lào Cai 33000, Vietnam

reviews.text: A quiet and serene lake in the center of Sa Pa. Come at night, more cooling and the lake surface shine with lights reflected from the buildings around.

Beautiful lake in the middle of Sapa. There were a variety of plants and even Sakura flowers when we visited in March.
There are plenty of cafes nearby to enjoy the scenery.
I like the weather here. It's a great experience to go for a jogging in the morning, and you can just keep walking and walking at night.
Sitting at this iconic spot in Sapa, surrounded by breathtaking views, instantly fills you with a sense of serenity and comfort.
Sa Pa is great, Good hiking, very kind people, excelent shopping....

data.formatted_address: 8RPV+92G, Thạch Sơn, TT. Sa Pa, Sa Pa, Lào Cai, Vietnam
data.name: Sapa Park

reviews.text: 6 hours north of Hanoi Vietnam, must see fancipan mountain, very hilly around town, electric vehicles in abundance , home stays with the hill tribes of the area and trecking

Such a beautiful park with a great crystal clear lake and clean walkway. It was quite a sight just walking and seeing all the great residents and commercial buildings all come together. Makes for great place to take pictures and relax. Lots of nice and wonderful people walking and hiking here as well.
A peaceful park in the heart of Sapa town with beautiful scenery and a variety of activities to enjoy. Good for couples, families, and people-watchers.

Amazing lake in Sapa with great views. Was able to take many amazing pictures and videos. Awesome weather always. When it is not so foggy, able to see the peak of Mount Fansipan. There are many food options around as well! My favourite would be Cooler city ice cream as it is not too sweet and a vietnamese pizza street stall just beside Mixue ice cream stall.

im guide in vietnam
I guided a lot of teams from Sapa. But take it as advice. You should avoid the top of the mountain in the morning. Hot air goes up in the morning and hot air goes down at lunch. I recommend between 4 p.m. and 6 p.m. Even if it rains, you can see a great view if you are lucky. But I don't recommend it if the schedule is not busy. A minority guide is worth a try, but you cannot be free from all kinds of bugs and germs. The animals and plants that live in Sapa have endured more trials than you thought. They are very tough and good at gisaeng. Don't trek too high. Shorts for trekking are prohibited

data.formatted_address: Đường Lên, TT. Sa Pa, Sa Pa, Lào Cai, Vietnam
data.name: Khu Du Lịch Sinh Thái Hàm Rồng SaPa

reviews.text: It’s a nice place to walk around, with a lovely viewpoint of the city (Cloud Yard). 70K per person so a reasonable entry price. A lot of the decoration was artificial so made it feel like it was made specifically for tourists. There are a lot of stairs to climb so prepare yourself for that! Saying all of this, the nature was lovely and there are also plenty of places to stop along the way for refreshments.

View was beautiful although it was a quite foggy when we went, the whole park was maintained very well. Have to pay for an entrance fee, a bit of hiking/climbing up stairs to do, so have to be extra careful especially when some directions could be confused. Remember to take a map! Anyway all roads will surely lead you up to the cloud yard, where you can see the whole Sapa city!

Interesting and easy hike to Ham Rong Mountain. Sadly, there are a few places scattered with litter. The view was nice given the cloudy weather, there are a few flower parks on the way up.
The scenic lookout was good and enjoyable.

No plan for here. It is just got nothing to do with our extra time we have so we thought that this would be the best place to kill our time. Well, it is ok. We got a few great photos and view the whole town from here. Only visit here when you have no other places to go.

To be honest, I did not plan to go to this place in the first place but the Sunworld cable car was closed unexpectedly so I was looking for some outdoor activity for alternative. The entry fee was 70,000 D which I think it’s reasonable since the park was very large. There are two main area: the flower park and the hill. The flower park was just okay. The hill was nice maintained and the path was in good condition. The uphill walking was not hard and you can reach the peak (Cloud yard/San May) by 10-15 minute. However the park is so large that you can spend more time exploring the nature. They did not give you a map by default so here is the photo of map I got.

There is an entrance fee of 200.000 VND. Spacious place, lots of people at some point.
Roses and hydrangeas so beautiful.
Beautiful landscape with Japanese and retro style, a unique check-in location❤️
Nice place to be in the shallow pool in middle of the jungle and rice terraces in Sapa
Amazing place to do photo shoot
Homestay suited for backpackers or honeymoon. The staff is helpful and pleasant. Other services such as laundry, motorbikes renting are available for incredibly low prices.

data.name: Cat Cat Village

data.formatted_address: 8V7G+MJC, Lao Chai, Sa Pa, Lao Cai, Vietnam
data.name: Thung Lũng Mường Hoa

reviews.text: If you do not have time to explore the Hmong village, you can take a motorbike ride all the way here for this view. It is worth the visit. The view is breathtaking. You will never regret it.

We have stayed in Mama Chi Homestay in early April and were trekking around Muong Hoa valley. There are so many treks around here, so if you have the opportunity, stay min. of 3 nights. During our visit, rice terraces were beginning to be flooded.

Muong Hoa valley is a beautiful place with picturesque terraced fields and Muong Hoa stream. It is an ideal check-in point when traveling. It is an intact, pristine valley that still retains its peace. peace and culture no longer exist in today's modern world.

What a beautiful valley with rice terraces everywhere. We walked with a local guide who was very knowledgeable and took us through the most beautiful passages and streams with the best views.

We were very lucky as the weather was clear throughout the trek. It's highly recommended if you love nature and trekking. You should wear good trekking shoes as some areas are tricky and slippery.

A trekking heaven. Took me a total of 7hrs to and fro from Sapa Square to the village, then continued to Lao Cai village. Total about 27k steps or 15km to cover the trips. There are few free toilet along the tracks. Do enjoy the scenery... went there during Dec, it is cooling all the way, but views are less attractive compared to if you visit during summer due to mists and foggy at the distance.  You glet better blue sky in Aug-Sep.

data.formatted_address: Số Nhà 02, Ngõ 733 Đường Điện Biên Phủ, TT. Sa Pa, Sa Pa, Lào Cai, Vietnam
data.name: Sapa Original Trek ( Sapa Tours + Fansipan Trekking - Sapa Travel Agency )

reviews.text: An amazing tour company! Mr Tinh is a very helpful man and always looks to support you in booking or on the tour. Our guide, Mo, was amazing, super friendly and extremely knowledgeable about the surrounding area, explaining any question we had in very good english! I would recommend Sapa Original Trek in a heartbeat to anybody looking to do a Sapa trek. The homestays were very nice and accomodating with very local foods, all grown by the family themselves. This felt like a proper trek, seeing the ‘unseen sights’ - we only came across 3 other tourist groups during the trek. Ps. July is a GREAT time of year to come (see photos), everything is green and beautiful!!!

It was an early morning. On the way to the trailhead we saw a beautiful sunrise. The trail started alongside a river with a nice boardwalk then the ascend started through lush green forest. The hike was indeed strenuous (coming from someone that hikes a lot) cause it's mainly stairs. The views though and the trek just unbelievably gorgeous. The lunch was perfect and my guide just really kind.
My friend unfortunately hurt her ankle so she took the funicular up but we met up top. We both took the funicular down and Tinh (who runs the company) picked both us up from the parking lot. He even offered us a room in the office to shower and freshen up and we were allowed to leave our luggage while we still explored the city. The level of hospitality and kindness was just outstanding. I can't recommend them and the tour enough. So far it was the best day of the Vietnam travel journey for sure. So again, thank you!!!!

Where do I start? From start to finish, both the office team and guides were simply fantastic - friendly, organised, happy to answer questions etc.

Communication in the few days before was spot on. Meeting the guides (Silver and Xan) and beginning the trek was slick, all very simple and to plan. They only do private tours, which for us was perfect.

The Bahn Mi, fruit and snacks during the days were tasty and more than adequate amounts. Dinner in the evening was a yummy hotpot! Dietary requirements are taken at the beginning of which we didn't have any. Rice wine and multiple sleeping bags is enough to keep anyone warm through the night!

After the trek we had a nice hot shower and we're able to repack all bags ready for the night bus to Hanoi!

We thoroughly enjoyed our two day adventure even if the view was masked by thick fog at the top. A huge thanks to all involved and I'd very much recommend these guys!

An unforgettable experience!! A MUST if in Sapa!
Super smooth process, met at the head office in Sapa before the trek where we were able to leave big bags/luggage and were provided with 3L of water to carry on the two day trek. Then met our crew which consisted of Sinh our tour guide and the two porters. A mini bus dropped us off at the start of the hike. Sinh made the trek super memorable. He was funny and informative. We saw lots of beautiful scenes and wild life. The food the porters made for us was delicious. Super authentic and yummy!!! The porters even provided/carried our sleeping bags and mats up. The trek is difficult, but worth every bit of pain. At the end of the trek you get picked up and taken back to head office where you can shower and rest if needed. Could not fault this experience one bit!!!

Thankyou to the SAPA original trek team!!!

The trek was amazing. Overall everything is smooth from hotel pick up to sending us back. Our guide Cho is helpful and friendly and he kept a pace thats suitable for us. A picnic lunch is provided at the base camp near the top. 10/10 will recommend Sapa Original Tour to anyone who wants to conquer Fansipan

reviews.text: A lovely couple trip in Sapa with Keyni, we trekking to Silver and Love waterfall in the morning then we back to town for our delicious lunch, after the lunch Keyni take us to him Village for a short trekking around, the view of the traditional house and terraced very nice, we have the Opportunity to see the local people they work on the farm. This is a really nice trip everyone should do.

We had a wonderful hike around Sapa, the scenery with breathtaking views that I have never seen before … of course, we wish we could come back here for more in the near future ….
The tour guide was very knowledgeable, enthusiastic and spoke excellent Eglish, explaining in depth about the culture and cuisine there, he patiently ansswered all of our questions. What's more important,  he has a sense of humor, which makes the trip more enjoyable ^^
Best experience ever!! love love
Extremely wonderful and exciting 3 days 2 nights trip with a local tour guide,  walked through rice terraces and villages. Resting at a homestay is an enjoyable experience.
Great day hike with Keyni, a professional and helpfull guide, the breathing scenery of green rice fields and local villages.
Great sapa trekking, my couple we did 1day trek with Sinh who show us the loca lculture and take us to the best majestic places in sapa, we would like yo recommendation.

data.formatted_address: 8RQF+6GP, Sa Pa, Lao Cai, Vietnam
data.name: Sun World Fansipan

reviews.text: 800k ticket for return cable car ticket, hold onto your ticket you will need it to come back down.  Recommended to walk up to the peak. Great views and take your time.
Great experience.. amazing views by the cable cars, flower garden, temples, hiking the hills and the buffet.

Fansipan, also known as the "Roof of Indochina," is the highest mountain in Vietnam, standing at an impressive 3,147.3 meters (10,326 feet) above sea level. Located in the Hoang Lien Son mountain range in the northwest region of Vietnam, Fansipan offers breathtaking panoramic views of the surrounding landscape, including lush forests, terraced rice paddies, and distant mountain peaks.

Visiting Fansipan in Vietnam was an incredible experience! The cable ride was thrilling, and climbing up the stairs added to the adventure. The view from the top was absolutely breathtaking. A must-visit spot in Sapa!

We didnt get to use the cable car because the weather is foggy up there and it might be a waste of time and money trying to go to the second station, so we decided to just have fun at the first station. The scenery was very beautiful and we are definitely satisfied.

a must-visit place when you're in town!  If you want to come here, you have to check the weather.  maybe it would be better to go in the summer.  Yesterday's experience was that my friends and I couldn't climb to the top because the weather was very cold and foggy.  if there is a chance, maybe I will go again with nicer weather.

data.formatted_address: 8Q3G+93C, San Sả Hồ, Sa Pa, Lao Cai, Vietnam
data.name: The roof of Indochina

reviews.text: I love special geographical places, just like here, the roof of Indochina. I believe you have to be a bit lucky with the weather; it is quite an attraction to get there: the park, the funicular, the cable car, and finally, the steps up. while you enjoy that, the reward is at the top in clear weather. if that is not the case, it is certainly worth considering, it is expensive to go up with the cable car for Vietnamese standards. although they also indicate this well when you buy tickets.

Feels surreal. Rare opportunity to be in this surrounding and to catch the amazing views. However do keep in mind that the weather (and visibility) is unpredictable; can change within minutes. Definitely grateful to experience the sun and blue sky, along with the clouds and fog. Be prepared and bring warm clothing.

It's so cold here because of the rainy weather. 10°c. Check the weather before you come here. Wear proper clothes that suit the weather. Suggested to buy a round ticket for monorail. You also can climb the stairs if you don't want to buy the monorail ticket.
Can't believe I stepped on this roof of Indochina. It's foggy but still leaves its beauty. The fog made it so mystical. Luckily I got the chance to see the flag raising ceremony. It's interesting.
Great experience, the gigantic Buddha and guanyin statues are a sight to behold! Not for the physically unfit because there are a crazy amount of stairs. Wear a jacket because it's cold!

reviews.text:
Incredibly rude staff! We drove up with the scooter to make a short coffee stop and at that moment someone immediately walked up and said: photo 20,000. So we indicated that we did not want to have our picture taken.

Immediately afterwards he waved his hand at us to leave. I thought we misunderstood him because I couldn't imagine he meant this. He walked inside to get his phone and wrote in Google Translate: GO OUT! and looked very angry.

I have never experienced this.

If you want to make a nice stop as a tourist, don't go here and grab the following place: Roadside coffee with a view. They are incredibly friendly here and you also have a beautiful view!

BEAUTIFUL PLACE and a must go! So much more affordable than the other attractions and beautiful views. Amazing place to take photos, and the staff/owner was super friendly and accommodating, to help us take photos :)

Truly value and a gem near Sapa!
Super cool place to stop! Just 20k/person. Various places to take awesome photos and see beautiful views.
The place is gorgeous, we did some awesome photos and enjoyed it a lot, but the ticket price of 20000 dong per person seemed a little bit excessive to us.
20k VND entry per person, you can probably spend 10mins here taking pictures. Similar sights nearby, just go to one view point and its all the same.

reviews.text:
Beautiful Village maybe in winter

Here right now undergo renovation, for sure better development for tourism.
Expect road closure so only access is by motorbike for now
Tourist still flocking right now, entry ticket is up by 50% from last year

It says 2km from Sa Pa but reality is more, expect long way if you walking. Better use motorbike

Overall nice experience here to do photoshoot
Will come again if have chance on winter to see beautiful village

Went there on a public holiday. You can rent traditional SaPa traditional clothes and take a beautiful photo of mountain or waterfall scenery. Make sure you are fit to hike because there will be a lot of stairs going up and down.

Was a lovely Sunday excursion after lunch in Sapa. Drove a scooter there and parked (10,000 D) bought tickets and walked to the village. There were a few westerners but the traffic was 95% Vietnamese on holiday.
They get dressed up in traditional clothing and have a wonder in and out of this hill tribe village.

There are a lot of stairs to be climbed. We walked in from the gate. About 1 km. then went down the stairs a lot of stairs. Stopped half way down for a drink.  Pricy!! Then continued down. The village at the bottom
Is beautiful and all the Vietnamese dressed up really adds to the pageantry of it all.

The hike back up was tough on the knees so at about the half way mark we got motorcycle taxies back to the entrance.

The village it self seems to be on either side of a stream. Very picturesque.

It's amazing village and it just feels like going back in time, The town is so pretty. Soo many things going on. From folks dancing to horse riding. Everything is simply amazing. Highly recommended to visit this village.
A lovely experience, I much preferred this trek of all. Authentic experience even amongst the tourists! The north of Vietnam was a special place for me to visit.

data.formatted_address: Nguyễn Chí Thanh, phường Fansipan, Sa Pa, Lào Cai 330000, Vietnam
data.name: Ga cáp treo Sunworld đi Fansipan

reviews.text:
Don't listen to the haters. This place is an amazing feat of human expertise and labor. It also has some spectacular views.

Well worth the price of admission. Be aware that you will have to pay extra if you want to take the train up to the peak.   Dress warm as it can be quite windy and chilly up there.

Great tour, beautiful cable car ride to reach the peak where grand buddhist temple is situated . Wonderful arrangements by government.
Good tourist destination in Sapa.

We went on a monday at 10:00 a.m.. no queue or waiting time at all, we could walk straight through. Bought our tickets at the hotel for similar price, so no waiting to buy the tickets. Fairly expensive tickets but 100% worth it if you have good weather. Please ask your hotel first if the weather is good (or will be good that day) before going up. For us, the sky was blue which provided the most incredible view of my life. It was not wet, no hard wind and warm due to the sun. Perfect experience but, as mentioned, the weather and visiting day (not in weekend) is very important.

View on Top is nice and can even be enjoyed while all the Insta tourist attack you for wanting to take pictures at your spot. The somewhat historical park at the bottom of the cable car station is obscure with its loud music and unneccessary waiting times (we had to wait for 20 Minutes without any reason as there were no people queuing for the cable cars).

For the price of 800k going up and down it’s pretty expensive but everyone is still doing it because it’s Sapas main attraction.

Really enjoyed our visit to Fansipan including the cable car ride up and back down as well as the walk up the many stairs to reach the summit. The stairs are well constructed but taxing so worth taking it easy, many breaks on the way up. The view can be all cloudy at times depending on the weather but there are moments of spectacular views that are breathtaking.

data.formatted_address: 12 Thạch Sơn, TT. Sa Pa, Sa Pa, Lào Cai, Vietnam
data.name: Sa Pa Town

reviews.text:
Memorable Stay in Sa Pa Town

My recent trip to Sa Pa Town was an unforgettable blend of adventure, relaxation, and vibrant nightlife. I stayed at the KK Sapa Hotel, which provided a luxurious and comfortable base for my explorations. The hotel is beautifully situated on a hill, offering panoramic views of the surrounding mountains.

During the day, I immersed myself in the rich culture and stunning landscapes of Sa Pa. The local markets were a treasure trove of handicrafts, textiles, and souvenirs. One of the highlights was a guided trek through the terraced rice fields and nearby villages, which you can see in the photos. The scenery was breathtaking, and it was fascinating to learn about the local way of life and the customs of the ethnic minority communities. Visiting Cat Cat Village provided a deeper understanding of the traditional lifestyles and crafts of the Hmong people.

When the sun set, Sa Pa Town transformed into a lively hub of activity. The nightlife was vibrant and diverse, offering a range of bars and clubs to explore. A standout experience was visiting "AMG Lounge" a club with an energetic atmosphere, lively music, and a friendly crowd. The mix of locals and tourists created a fun and welcoming environment, perfect for dancing the night away and making new friends. The vibrant lights and excellent selection of drinks added to the excitement, making it a night to remember.

The culinary scene in Sa Pa was another highlight of my trip. I had the chance to savor a variety of local dishes, from street food stalls to the hotel’s upscale restaurant. The flavors were rich and unique, reflecting the local ingredients and culinary traditions. I particularly enjoyed thang co, a traditional Hmong soup, and grilled skewers from the night market. Dining at the hotel’s restaurant was also a treat, with delicious meals enjoyed against the backdrop of misty mountains.

My stay in Sa Pa Town was an unforgettable experience filled with adventure, relaxation, and fun. The KK Sapa Hotel provided a luxurious and welcoming base, while the town itself offered endless opportunities for exploration and enjoyment. From trekking through stunning landscapes to experiencing the vibrant nightlife, every moment was memorable. I look forward to returning to Sa Pa and reliving these wonderful experiences.

The landscapes around Sapa are amazing, the rice fields, the mountains. Highly recommend.
Visit mount Fansipan.
Nice rice terraces in the villages nearby. The town is flooded with tourists. Too commercial to experience.
I love the weather, food, and scenery, and their people smile! As a solo traveler, I'm strongly recommended this town for you to visit 😊
A stop over place for people going for hikking in Lao Cai. But overall, it is a happening town, especially at night where all the shops lit up to decorate the town.

Great Potential…

Visited the museum 1) to learn a bit more about the different tribes in Sa Pa 2) It was miserable weather!

The information in there was very interesting just maybe needs a more modern approach to displaying 👍

Some good information on the history of Sapa, is a bit run down and from my guess, hasn’t been updated in quite a few years. Worth a stop off on a rainy day like we did.
Fully recommend visiting here to quickly learn some of the history of Sapa. Totally free and many interesting photos and exhibits.

data.formatted_address: San Sả Hồ, Sa Pa, Lao Cai, Vietnam
data.name: Silver Waterfall

reviews.text:
Silver Waterfall in Sapa is a breathtaking natural attraction that is well worth the climb. The ascent involves many steps, but the effort is rewarded with stunning views and a sense of accomplishment. Along the way, there are several rest spots perfect for taking breaks and capturing beautiful photos of the surrounding landscape.

It’s important to note that the steps can become quite slippery when it rains, so wearing appropriate shoes with good grip is essential for safety. The cool weather in Sapa adds to the charm of the experience, making the climb more pleasant even on warmer days. The pristine, shimmering silver water cascading down the rocks is a mesmerizing sight that lives up to its name.

Overall, Silver Waterfall is a must-visit for nature lovers and adventure seekers. The combination of scenic beauty, cool weather, and the refreshing sight of the cascading water makes it an unforgettable experience.

Just located by the main road. The road here is always wet because of this waterfall. On the other side of the road you will witness a beautiful landscape. I would prefer Love Waterfall more because it is a more natural feeling where I can hike in it. This is just climbing up the stairs. Actually the view is best at the bottom.
A beautiful place, we climbed the stairs for 30 minutes up, it was an effort but we reached an amazing view
It's nice. Probably more beautiful in winter time when there is more water. Not too hard to get to the top. I would recommend to go her only of it's on the way.
We visited the waterfall during the rainy season and its stream was super powerful. We liked the scenery and the sound of water streaming down the mountain.

reviews.text: The hotel is basically the best located in the entire village of Sapa. The hotel is impressive and has an interesting design, not something you see often in the world. The service is good and the food is pretty decent. But what really caught me by surprise is their spa service, I just had a 30 minute back massage, but it was one of the best ones that I have experienced. Pleasantly surprised!

I was staying at Hotel de la Couple for just 2 nights but the experience was fantastic. I’ve booked for the classic room, but they upgraded it to Superior without charge, really appreciate you guys for that! During the stay, Chloe from the reception team was help me a lot. Chloe was caring, friendly and have a good sense of humor to:)) She and Thanh also help me to arrange the car to go to the Lao Cai station. Thank you guys so much for making me and my family’s vacation memorable

Our trip to Sapa was like a dream. The hotel is amazing, the food is great, and the staff were extremely friendly and helpful. One of the highlights of the trip was how pleasant it was dealing with the staff. They took care of us and provided everything needed, especially Ta and Chien. I had informed the hotel that it was our honeymoon and they had set up a honeymoon bed to immortalize our stay or take it with us as a memento.

The most beautifully designed hotel in one of the most beautiful locations in the world among the clouds and mountains. The reception and restaurant staff were very welcoming. The unique pool is not to be missed. The breakfast selection was extensive and delicious. The hotel stay was an experience all to its own and felt like being transported in time to the art deco glamourousness of the1920s in Europe. The only area needing improvement was the menu at dinner. Had the Vietnamese dishes the first night which did not meet the standard of other Vietnamese food we've eaten during our 2 weeks in Vietnam. Next night we stuck to Western dishes.

This hotel is absolutely stunning. From the service to the design of this hotel, everything was wonderful. For breakfast, there was a large buffet selection, and Si made our experience even better. She was extremely attentive and friendly to us every morning!

My mom does not like outdoor pools so this hotel's indoor pool was perfection-- extremely clean and beautifully designed! We thoroughly enjoyed our stay!! Thank you!

The room overall is good except the closet  door is kind of noisy.
Good services with warm staff and cleaning ladies. Great experience with Cau May Restaurent. Seeyaaa soon Mường Thanh Sapa.

I like the hotel's space, a very pure Vietnamese space. The reception staff are friendly and professional, especially Ann.
Encourage everyone to come experience it.
One of the best places in Sa Pa. Highly recommend for all!

I stayed here for 2 nights. The room is clean and the food is delicious. The mountain view is beautiful, there is a stream next to it so taking virtual photos is great. The price is OK so vote 5 stars ^^

data.formatted_address: 067 Fansipan, Street, Sa Pa, Lào Cai 330000, Vietnam
data.name: Sapa Weather Trekking Tours

reviews.text:
Went on a 2 days hiking tour in Sapa Valley with Sapa Weather.

Wonderful experience. Everything that is mention in the website it is exactly as it is.

May is a wonderful operator with great guides that speak English. They ensure the hike is safe, explain the journey before hand and prepare me will for the hike.

More important, the entire supply chain of the hike directly benefit the local community. They have great understanding of the land and able to give you a great hiking and culture experience.

I was surprise that foraging from the forest is included in the trip. We walk along the trial and I was shown and get the oppotunity to try what the Black Hmong people forage from their forest for 100s of years.

I highly Recomend Sapa weather tracking tours. Be it you want a simple hike or a more challenging 2-3 days hike. You will be in good hand.

Ask for guide Su. She is very chatty and wonderful guide.

We had a great day soft-trekking with SaPa weather trekking tours. We were lucky and got the owner Mai as a guide for the day. Mai was super friendly, has a great sense of humour and shared lots of interesting facts about the local hill tribes and flora throughout the day. Cannot recommend her highly enough. Thanks for a splendid day Mai:)

The most beautiful trek in a local village with Mi. She was super accommodating and started later in the day for us. Also allowed us to do a shorter trek to accommodate all. Also offers longer treks. The local village and the scenery was lovely. Not to mention all the dogs we saw. She also showed us a stunning cafe to stop in at the start. And then joined us for lunch at the end. We didn’t feel rushed in the slightest

We had a wonderful day trekking up Fansipan mountain with an extremely kind and experienced tour guide. Our guide also had great snacks throughout the trek and a lovely lunch for us at the top.
Mai was very easy to work with.
We had an incredible experience with Mai and her team.

Had three amazing treks with Sapa Weather. Met some lovely guides from the local communities, they were so informative and made each tour so special! We had a relaxing night at the Homestay where we luckily did the local cooking course and batik making, they were awesome! Would recommend to anyone who wants an authentic trekking and Homestay experience in Sapa!!

data.formatted_address: 09 Thác Bạc, TT. Sa Pa, Sa Pa, Lào Cai 330000, Vietnam
data.name: Trekking Tour Sapa

reviews.text: Excellent service from booking the tour to completing our trek. Our tour guide Xay was extremely knowledgeable about the area and took her time to explain the culture of her Hmong people. She spoke great English and tailored her speed to ours, allowing us to stop when needed. We did the mountain trek day tour and although it rained throughout the day, it was an amazing trek and we thoroughly enjoyed the views. Thank you so much!

We were lucky enough to have Zhu as our guide. She is very patient and very kind, knowing the area very well (although we chose the less frequented one). her explanations of local life and traditions were a delight. The evenings spent with local people were a real immersion into the heart of their families (a small dedication to Mary Kay,  who, at 5 years old, brightened up our evening). The scenery is fantastic, and despite the bad weather on the last day, it didn't dampen our spirits or our enjoyment of the walk between Laos and China. The little shower on the way back to Sapa was welcome and absolutely necessary. Finally, beware: this 3-day/2-night trip is pretty sporty, as it goes up and down.

Exceptional 3 day trek with Tong around Sa Pa and its surrounding villages. It was a real pleasure to be integrated with her family and tribes people with trying on their clothing, learning some of their cultural ways and being embraced with only joy and happiness. The homestay’s were also so neat and tidy, showers were excellent and food was delicious and abundant (definitely none of us were hungry at any point!). I would highly recommend anyone to do this trip and if you are to select the more challenging walk, be ready to be ascending and descending a lot.

The 3D2N "Experience The Real Sapa" trekking tour was, hands down, the best travel experience I have had in Vietnam so far! Our guide Tung was friendly, helpful and knew all about the different plants and their uses, the cultures of the area. She took us through safe passages with incredible views.

We enjoyed two home stays with excellent meals, comfortable beds and peaceful scenery. Thank you hosts!

3 days is a lot, but definitely worth it if you want to go "off the beaten track" and see the real Sa Pa.

We did a three day and two night trip in July. The trip was fantastic with great weather and an excellent local guide. The walking was much more challenging than a ‘walk’ but there were choices of an ‘easy’ or  ‘hard’ route. The views were stunning and we could go our own pace. The home stays were very good. Lots of good local food and very clean and welcoming. Our guide Tong was super. Kind and friendly and very keen to help. Highly recommended but you need to be fit and agile!!

data.formatted_address: Số 09, ngõ 29 Fansipan, TT. Sa Pa, Sa Pa, Lào Cai, Vietnam
data.name: Sapa Sisters

reviews.text: An absolutely amazing experience. One of the highlights of our 8 month tour of SE Asia. We did a single day trek followed by a 2 day/1 night trek. Both were fantastic. Not only is the scenery spectacular, but the stories and insights into the local culture that the guides shared were so interesting. You can't come to Sapa and not do this! And do use Sapa Sisters because it is ethical. Companies that offer the same pay their guides next to nothing.

Absolutely recommend going with Sapa sisters. This was an incredible experience, and this agency should be your choice for Sapa! We did a 3D/2N walking tour including home stay and local stay. It is the best way to get an understanding of the local customs and life, and to see the beautiful mountains in Sapa. Su was our guide and she was such a fun and great person to have around and guide us. We also had our local stay with her. She and her family went above and beyond for my birthday too. Can’t thank them enough! Go do this.

The best experience of our trip to Sapa! We trekked with Mi who was so joyful. She shared so many stories about the places we were passing and about the H’mong people. She provided us two options at a few points: Nature or Easy. We opted to take the Nature path for most parts and the easy path after lunch, as we had food coma after eating The Best Meal of our trip to Vietnam in her house. She took us back to her place, where we met her family and had a scrumptious yet simple meal of rice, Potato Stew, Pork Stir fry, chicken with vegetables and tofu.

I would most definitely recommend the Sapa Sisters for your next trek in Sapa. The entire way, we were on our own, barely saw tourists. A true local experience.

I had the best 3 day 2 night trek with Sapa Sisters. Little Chi was the most amazing guide! She was patient, customized the trek based on my preferences, and even took me on an impromptu ride to a hidden waterfall when it was too rainy to hike the mountains. She explained everything from her life in the village, their customs, to the plants and fruits we passed along the way. She even invited me to her home to cook and have lunch with her family. It was an unforgettable experience and I’m grateful to have gotten a local look into this beautiful piece of the world!

The trek with sapa sisters exceeded our expectations! We booked 2d1n and had Khu lead us around mountains, rice fields and bamboo forests. The hike itself was pretty easy and we only walked 15km the first day but the views were great and Khu gave us lots of information on the tribes and their lives. She spoke great English and was super funny!

The home stay was basic but comfortable and food was good everywhere we ate. Although it was sunny when we went, the paths are muddy so bring shoes you’re happy to throw away at the end of the trek.

reviews.text:
I had a great trip in VIet Nam and I want to say Thank you so much for Jenny - the friendly and helpful girl who help me to arrange all of services to Sapa and Ha Long Bay.  Everything is so great with professional tour
guide, beautiful boat and nice view in Sapa.

Fantastic tour was had to Ninh Binh for 2 days. The tour had much variety, not flat chat so that you could actually enjoy and experience what the region has to offer which is beautiful.  The lunches were very good too.
I do want to mention though that the tour company (mainly Jenny) went above and beyond in her service to me.  I unfortunately got covid whilst in Hanoi (never had before) and it knocked me.  Jenny managed change my trip booking a few times to ensure that I stilll was able to do it, and kept me in the loop of timings, pick ups, etc.  And at no extra charge.  But in addition Jenny made welfare checks each day to see how I was going and provided much support as I was a single traveller.  Who does this these days?  I was blown away by her compassion and support.  A real empathy for my illness and cared for me to still be able to see ninh binh.  Thank You thank you thank you.

Thank you Jenny and Linda for the perfect service. Our group of 20 members have had a fantastic trip thanks to your organization. Vietnam is really beautiful and we are sure to come back in the near future. Sapa and Halong as well Ha Giang is our must and we will keep in touch - Lovely and caring team.

Perfect Halong Sapa package for anyone visits Vietnam!!!
We booked Halong Sapa 4 days with Ms Jenny – Hoang Oahn. From the first email, everything went smoothly. Jenny is so nice to listen to all our request since ourgroup have 2 small child (5 and 8 years old), so we need to arrange all carefully. Hotels, train cabins, tour guides are perfect. Although we booked Halong, Sapa but Vietnam Typical Tours with young active staff is always willing to support us from many shops, spa, res and markets. We just felt free to enjoy all things.  One more thing that we found Vietnam Typical Tours so special is that they will be wholehearted with you  once you contacted them.  Yep. Thank Vietnam Typical Tours for making our trip in Vietnam so excellent! Thank you all! And for sure, we will book with us in our holiday next year. Hope to see you soon.

Really that I and my friend (who comes from Australia) enjoyed Sapa 4 nights 3 days from Hanoi, we had the good experience about the life way of the local people and understand about their customs, admired the amazing landscapes of Sapa. After Sapa tour, we still continued to book Halong bay tour with Vietnam Typical Tours and it was very great to enjoy Halong bay on the boat. We want to express our big thanks to you - Vietnam Typical Tours and will come back to you in the near future.

Jessica.

reviews.text: Get to experience the local food in Sapa. Many are selling their produce on the street. Less hassler. People are friendly.

Stalls can get quite repeated in variety, so if you do want to purchase an item, do compare prices. You can find most items at the small shops along the touristic Cat Cat Village too.

What stood out were the freshly made chestnut pancake which was quite unique, great for the cold and misty nights.
Sapa is a Very Mystique Place to be where it can get Very Cold.. Breath Taking Place to be..,
It was fun, full of selling kind of food, and cheap fruits

We enjoyed it more than Hanoi night market which mostly sell clothes and fake crocs. More options of foods but still not a lot of variances of seller (mostly Chinese herbs, dry meats, nuts). Small enjoyable night market. Try the che (dessert) in one of the food stand.. it was delicious.

data.name: Hồ Chí Minh Friendship Monument

reviews.text: Bumped into this monument while walking around the Sapa town. I was here but i do not understand what is written on the monument as it was written in Vietnamese language.

The Ho Chi Minh Friendship Monument is quite a fine monument, but will be lost on most people without a translation from a native speaker, which tells you it is a message from Ho Chi Minh's heart to the people of Safa. Highly revered of course.

I was most impressed with the carving on the back side of the monument, and have posted a picture of it.

But why is it also called 'The Monument on the Lake' I don't know! It's next to the amphitheatre and the Stone Church in the middle of town - not next to the lake. Why not just call it the "Ho Chi Minh Friendship Monument".

This is a pretty good monument, but would be lost on most people without a translation from native speakers, which tells you it was a message from Ho Chi Minh's heart to the people of Safa. Of course very respectful.

I was most impressed with the engraving on the back of the monument, and there is a poster of its image.

But why is it called 'Monument on the Lake' I don't know! It's next to the theater and the Stone Church in the middle of town - not next to the lake. Why not call it "Ho Chi Minh Friendship Monument".

data.formatted_address: P. Hàm Rồng, TT. Sa Pa, Sa Pa, Lào Cai 333100, Vietnam
data.name: Notre Dame Cathedral

reviews.text:
The Notre Dame Cathedral in Sapa stands as the most iconic building in the region, captivating visitors with its timeless beauty both day and night. Steeped in history, this church holds a significant place in the hearts of locals and tourists alike.

During my visit, I marveled at the architectural marvel both inside and out. The interior design exudes a sense of tranquility and reverence, complementing the grandeur of the exterior. It's evident that careful attention has been paid to every detail, creating a truly immersive experience for visitors.

Not only is the Notre Dame Cathedral a symbol of faith, but it also serves as a cultural landmark, representing the rich heritage of the region. Amidst the bustling streets of Sapa, this sanctuary offers a moment of serenity and reflection.

Whether you visit during the day to admire its majestic facade or at night to witness its illuminated beauty, the Notre Dame Cathedral is sure to leave you breathless. It's a must-see destination for anyone exploring the enchanting landscapes of Sapa.

Nothing special here unless you are a religious person. It's just sad to see a lot of kids here wearing fancy clothes to attract tourists to take their photos and collect tips. So young and so small started to carry babies. It is affecting the kids from growing up. Shame on their parents.

An exquisite church that been exist since French colonial era and it well maintained until now. The place located just in front of amphitheater where many people from Hmong ethnic usually there to make a living. When you're in Sapa, this is one of many things you can visit, whether to take a picture of it or just to admire.

Sapa holds a significant piece of France’s colonial history from 1893 to 1954, during which the Stone Church, an enduring remnant of that era, stands tall. Among the few surviving structures are the Stone Church, Hoang Lien Hotel, and the Sapa Tourism Information Centre. Nestled at 1,500 meters above sea level and over 300 km from Hanoi, Sapa remained secluded and underdeveloped during French colonial rule, resulting in the absence of European architectural influences.

Initially used sparingly for religious worship, this church began services in 1935, paused during the Japanese occupation (1940-1945), and resumed until 1954. After a period of disuse, restoration efforts began in 1995, softening strict regulations and revitalizing the church for worship.

Inside, the church's interior is a vibrant contrast to its rugged exterior. White, yellow, and brown tones from varnished wood dominate the space. 32 stained glass windows, depicting biblical scenes, adorn the walls. Among regional churches, Sapa's Stone Church stands out, offering a unique experience.

What's fascinating is the congregation, primarily from the local minority ethnic groups, notably the Hmong. Situated in Sapa's main square, this church hosts diverse events, including the renowned Saturday night Love Markets.

Once a tradition for hill tribes to find partners from different villages, the Love Markets symbolize a bygone era. Though the practice has dwindled, visitors can still witness performances that once played a role in uniting young individuals from various communities.

The Stone Church, an emblem of Sapa's history, not only represents architectural heritage but also stands as a testimony to cultural traditions that have evolved over time.

data.formatted_address: 8QWC+RV8, Sơn Bình, Tam Đường District, Lai Chau, Vietnam
data.name: Love Waterfall

reviews.text: Great waterfall! We went during the middle of the day and we couldn’t believe it!?!? The sun was out despite the whole of Sa Pa being stuck in grey clouds and there were no tourists. The waterfall is defo worth and visit and it’s a lovely 25-30min non strenuous walk, a few uneven steps to climb but nothing major. Make sure to bring your swimsuit to have a refreshing dip!

Silver waterfall and love waterfall are the most famous waterfalls here at Sapa. If you really have to choose to visit only one of the waterfall. This is the one. I like this more because I can get to the bottom of the waterfall. Meanwhile, the silver waterfall is beside the main road. Not natural enough.

Very easy to trek as the way to the Love Waterfall is paved. We went in late March, and there was only a little water at the fall. Despite that, we enjoyed the hike very much; it was very quiet and peaceful. The surrounding scenery was breathtaking, with lush greenery and the sound of birds chirping adding to the serene atmosphere. It was a refreshing escape into nature.

This place is absolutely stunning! Have to pay for the entrance fees but definitely worth it. Thought it was just a trekking path to the waterfall, but along the way the view is so beautiful!! You can even see some buffalos too. A must to visit when you have time in Sapa!

Went in Apr 2024
Although it was very misty and cold, the hike up was very easy and clear. There were some flies buzzing around at first but they went away after about 15min.

The water was very cool and nice, there were only a couple of other people around when we visited.

Take note to bring along some cash, there is an entrance fee

Would advise if weather is great throughout SaPa you wouldn’t be missing much if you didn’t visit. It just so happened this was the only place in SaPa that had the sun 😂

"Heaven's Gate" in Sapa

"Heaven's Gate in Sapa is truly a hidden gem worth the visit. The journey to this stunning viewpoint is an adventure in itself, with winding roads offering breathtaking views of the lush valleys below. Upon reaching the gate, you are greeted with a panoramic vista of rolling hills, terraced rice fields, and misty mountains that seem to touch the sky. The beauty of nature at Heaven's Gate is simply awe-inspiring and definitely a must-see for any traveler seeking tranquility and natural beauty."
Place feels like heaven, when fog,clouds, and wind come along together, u will feel like angle home.

The place is beautiful seriously beautiful. It would be more beautiful if the weather is clear and bright. Despite misty weather, we still can see the beauty of the place. Weather is uncertain, hoping can get a chance to visit again in the future.

This charming lake is surrounded by lush greenery and offers stunning views, making it a popular spot for visitors seeking relaxation and tranquility.Visitors can enjoy leisurely strolls around the lake, taking in the serene atmosphere and snapping photos of the beautiful scenery. The surrounding area often features cafes and vendors selling refreshments, allowing visitors to enjoy a drink or snack while admiring the views.

The lake is quite small which is just nice for us. As December is low season, we got the whole lake to ourselves.
The Fog coming & going. So so Magical.

The river is located in the town of Dapa, about a 15-minute drive from General Luna. The entrance fee is quite expensive but the highlight of Sapa sa Maasin River is the bent palm tree swing. The swings is no longer available since a storm swept this area last 2021.

In addition to the swing, Sapa sa Maasin River also offers canoeing. Canoeing is a great way to explore the river and get up close to the mangrove trees.

Sapa sa Maasin River is a great place to relax and enjoy the natural beauty of Siargao Island. The river is also a great place to take photos and have some fun.

Here are some of the pros and cons of Sapa sa Maasin River:

Pros:

Beautiful river setting
Bent palm tree swing
Opportunity to go canoeing
Not too crowded

Cons:

Can be a bit slippery
The swings are no longer available
Its a good experience! Pero I think its too expensive to be on a small paddle of water after the boat ride.

Sapa is a town located in Lao Cai province, Northern Vietnam. Located at an altitude of about 1,500 meters above sea level, Sapa is surrounded by majestic mountains and is known as one of Vietnam's most attractive tourist destinations.

Sapa has a temperate climate and winter lasts from November to March, with temperatures that can drop below 0 degrees Celsius. This town is famous for its beautiful landscape, green terraced rice fields, waterfalls, pine forests and ethnic minority villages.

With its wild natural beauty, Sapa attracts tourists from all over the world. Visitors to Sapa often have the opportunity to participate in activities such as hiking, climbing mountains, exploring waterfalls and visiting traditional villages. One of the most popular destinations in Sapa is Fansipan, Vietnam's highest mountain peak, where visitors can enjoy stunning views from the summit.

In addition, Sapa also has a diverse and unique culture, with the presence of ethnic minorities such as H'Mong, Dao, Giay and Xa Pho. Visitors can visit traditional villages, learn about the unique culture of each ethnic group, and participate in exchange activities with the local community.

Sapa also has a crowded and bustling market, where visitors can shop for traditional handmade products such as clothes, bags, hats, and unique jewelry.

In particular, eating local cuisine is an experience not to be missed when coming to Sapa. Visitors can enjoy specialties such as grilled pork, fish with tamarind sauce, armpit pig and can wine of the H'Mong ethnic group.

Sapa is an attractive and captivating destination with wonderful natural beauty and unique national culture. Exploring Sapa will bring visitors memorable and unforgettable experiences.

data.formatted_address: 1pho Ng. Cầu Mây, TT. Sa Pa, Sa Pa, Lào Cai, Vietnam
data.name: Sapa Center

reviews.text:
Sapa Center is more than just a geographical point—it's a vibrant hub of activity where people gather for various pursuits. During my visit, I witnessed the lively spirit of Sapa as young locals gathered to kick footballs under the hot sun, showcasing the community's energetic and communal nature.

As night falls, the atmosphere transforms, with a multitude of sales and activities lighting up the area. Exploring the nighttime scene, I encountered a diverse array of offerings, from local crafts to handmade products sold by indigenous artisans. It's a testament to the rich cultural tapestry of Sapa and an opportunity to support local artisans while experiencing the unique charm of the region.

Whether you're soaking in the daytime hustle and bustle or immersing yourself in the nighttime festivities, Sapa Center offers an authentic glimpse into the heart and soul of the community. It's a place where culture thrives, connections are made, and memories are forged—a must-visit destination for anyone exploring the enchanting landscapes of Sapa.

Sapa Town is a picturesque destination nestled amidst the stunning mountains of northern Vietnam. The town's charm lies in its vibrant mix of culture, breathtaking landscapes, and welcoming atmosphere. Visitors can explore colorful markets, embark on scenic treks to nearby villages, and indulge in delicious local cuisine. Sapa Town offers a unique and unforgettable experience for travelers seeking adventure and cultural immersion.

There's not much happening at Sapa Center in the morning. At night, it becomes very crowded with child beggars dancing everywhere. Be cautious when showing your money, as they will swarm around you asking for more.

I was there from 22-27 Jan 2022, just few days ago so I hope my review would be most recent and I believe May is running better and better day after day.

May offered me everything I need back then. Serenity? Yes! Blue sky? Yes! Floating cloud sea? Yes! Privacy? Yes! Personalized experience? Yes! Know-how H'Mong people' lives? Yes! Treking? Yes! Hiking at the 2200m high mountain? Yes! Home-made Pumpkin Milk? Yes! Salmon? Yes! All the best meals cooked by the host? Yes! Cozy talks? Yes! Even, karaoke at nights? Yes!... May can give me everything and I am giving May all my best words, to anyone that I can share this experience with... I love all the natural beauty that May is keeping, I love all the homely food that May is making and I just love so much my 5 last days with May..

I hope you can be there someday, trust me, you will love how May love its place, May is a corner deep into the most beautiful bamboo/ cherry blossoms forests of Sapa... May is a really get-away place that you can consider to visit, and revisit anytime you can.. And I am doing so. I will be back to May the soonest, when I want to find sometime for myself, to reflect my own soul, to be with the nature and to be loved by May...

Promise me, you will be there as a retreat for your best work? You deserve May, deserve to enjoy the best... May is friendly and May will wecome you anytime...

All my best love to you and May,

data.name: Sapa Garden Hotel

reviews.text: A very pleasant 2 night stay in a nice size room. Clean bathroom. Window can open for fresh air. Short walk from city centre so away from the night noise. Breakfast prepared to order ( eggs/bread or noodle soup). Very friendly manager. Excellent value - recommended.

Amazing owners and nice location!
Thank you for hosting us at your hotel, the boss is very very friendly, and the location is great. We got a room that is not noisy and and without very comfortable to stay here for two nights.
Recommended!

This is a four star review for a two night stay. This is a good hotel with inconsistencies that can easily be fixed. The largest disappointment came from being refused late checkout in a hotel that was very empty (housekeeping leaves all the rooms open as they clean them, and we were practically the only guests in the hotel). The hotel manager gave no logic for refusing late checkout but did offer us tea and to use a shower after checkout.

Room: Had a soft and comfortable bed, a safe, balcony, and fridge. The room itself was a five star room, however the bathroom had a dirty towel folded up as if it was clean when we arrived. See attached photo; it looks like it was used to kill bugs and then folded up and placed back in the bathroom. This was a nasty surprise but can be easily avoided as this was a very clean hotel otherwise. Toiletry bottles were mini and not full.The hair drier in 302 did not work and is dangerous as it heats up and short circuits because the fan function within it is not working. Basically a toaster.

Breakfast: Highlight of the property. Had the chicken noodle soup both mornings with very fresh fruit. Eggs also an option. The coffee is much stronger than other local coffees we tried brewed in the same local fashion, and could have used a bit less ground in it.

Area: Good spot which is up the hill away from the main strip leading to more quiet but also more walking to get to things. Close to Sapa Station. Our tour guide explained Sa Pa is a town developed rapidly for exploitation of the natural environment and the Indigenous areas around it and is thus not well integrated into its surroundings. There is constant construction and the architecture is not unique or authentic to the region. We will stay in a mountainside hotel instead of a hotel in town next time.

Accessibility: No elevator and slippery walkway to get to entrance. I would not recommend this hotel for people with mobility issues.

Value: One of the more expensive hotels we stayed at in Vietnam however Sa Pa is more expensive due to a real estate boom and its rural location up a mountain.

One of the highlights of our stay was the hotel staff. They were incredibly kind and helpful throughout our visit. They allowed us to check in earlier than expected and even upgraded our room, which was a pleasant surprise. Additionally, they kept our baggage after check-out, which made our last day in Sa Pa more convenient. They also assisted us in ordering a bus ticket to Hanoi, which was cheaper compared to the internet prices.

In terms of amenities, the hotel provided a good breakfast selection that satisfied our morning appetite. The availability of a heat pump for both heating and cooling was convenient, ensuring that we were comfortable regardless of the weather outside. Wi-Fi connection was also reliable.

During our stay, it happened to be Christmas time, and the hotel invited us to join their family Christmas dinner. This was an unexpected gesture that made us feel welcomed and added a special touch to our vacation. The homemade dinner food was rich and flavourful, and it was a delightful experience to celebrate the holiday with the hotel staff and their loved ones as we were far away from our families.

This hotel is certainly worth considering if you're looking for a budget-friendly option with friendly service and a cosy atmosphere. Throughout our visit, we struggled to identify any substantial drawbacks, making it a solid choice for a pleasant stay in Sa Pa.

We stayed 1 night in the suit and we came back for 2 extra night after going to the villages around Sa Pa. This place is so lovely and all the staff is very friendly and helpful.

reviews.text:
What a gem of a location. From the moment we decided to come to Sapa for a bit of rest and relaxation they have been on top of everything. I was wondering if the hotel was more of a travel agency with a few rooms attached but found when we drives that no it was a lovely Inn with an amazing owner who looks after his guests as well as his garden and Inn.

This is not a bed and breakfast but an inn. You get your own room with all the things you would get at a hotel. Staff that look after you. Light your fireplace if you need it. Owners lovely mother (Mama) who ensures that you’re fed well. Room was clean and well appointed.

Enjoyed it so much. 4 more days to look forward too.

This B&B is the best place we have stayed at in all of SE Asia. We have been traveling for 5 months, so that says a lot. The service was phenomenal. The grounds were amazing even in winter. Room is large and has a great patio. Nam (the owner) and his staff were so kind. Check in was so easy, Nam was always available whenever we had questions. He called cabs for us multiple times, offered recommendations and even let us check out late, since our bus wasn’t until 15:00. The made to order breakfast was complimentary and delicious. And my favorite perk the heated bed pad. We are here in the winter and while not as cold as the USA, it’s still chilly at night. Having a heated bed after hiking in the cold, is a god send. I can not recommend this place enough and will definitely choose Sapa Garden again if we come back.

Went here on 10-12th of January with my friend. I love everything here, the foods, the staff, the atmosphere and the room. Everything are great. The owner are really helpful and kind. He arranged everything for us. I love my experience in Sapa more than Hanoi 😭 I think I should just stay in Sapa for a weeks than spending time in Hanoi.

Mountain room view has very little Mountain View. But, they have a lovely garden. It is 2km away from the sapa market. So, if you plan on renting a motorbike or have your own means of conveyance..then it is a good choice.

reviews.text: Had a great 2 night stay here. Breakfast is big and delicious. There is a good choice of options. I asked if I could get something vegetarian for lunch and for 50k I got a huge plate of fried rice and a bowl of tofu in tomato sauce. Delicious. For 190k we got a double bed private room with two big windows. The beds are really comfortable and the showers are powerful and hot. For 250k the reception were able to book us a bus to Hanoi. You can walk from the hostel into the town easily.

Booked two beds in a 10 dorm room. Arrived late and just went to bed. Next morning, I checked and the room had 22 beds, and it was nothing like the pictures (tiny bed, no curtain). When I asked the reception they said they were the same price so I could stay in the 22 bed one, the other one was full. When I said I didn't want a 22 bed one (that didn't have hot water either), they said I could maybe get a bed later in the 16 bed one. I asked them to cancel my booking, and offered to pay the first night. They made me pay the rate for the 10 bed one, even when people in front of me were paying way less for the 16 bed one, so I was grossly overpaying. Had to call them multiple times to confirm that they cancelled my reservation as booking would charge me otherwise.
I guess the room was clean, all things considered.

We paid for a 10 person room with curtains in the bed and we were given a 22 person room with beds that looked like coffins, with no curtains and no hot water in the shower. When we tried to talk to front desk the lady screamed at me when I told her I did not want the 22 person room, that I wanted what I paid for. We ended up having to cancel our reservation because they told us there was no room available in the 10 person so we just had to stay in the 22. Booking then asked us for a confirmation of cancellation from the hostel so we called and they hung up the phone on us.

One of the worst hostels I’ve stayed in. Booked a 10 room was put in a 22 room with 1 bathroom. My friends bed had bed bugs, my bed had white stains on. There was no air con and the lights didn’t work. When we spoke to the manager and said I wasn’t happy paying full price she took my friends passport and put it in her bag and then tried to drive off with it. This is one of the worsts places I’ve ever stayed

Mike is incredibly helpful and will help you with everything you need! He suggested daily itineraries which we ended up going with, and we were so happy we did. He set up an amazing trekking tour, and the weather was beautiful. Thanks for everything! The staff and the breakfast was 10/10. We stayed in the private rooms, which are not sound proofed so bring ear plugs. Also be aware that smoking is allowed indoors in the main area, if you're sensitive. Great for a budget stay, would recommend for affordability.

reviews.text: The Ecolodge is well located - sufficiently far from the village center to feel more connected to nature but allowing us to enjoy a 2-hour walk to visit the old monastery and go to the herbal baths. The lobby and restaurant have a very nice atmosphere and were beautifully decorated. The restaurant menu offered numerous options of home-made dishes with locally grown ingredients. The rooms were also nicely decorated, big and comfortable, except for the mattress which was too soft. We felt like in a farm, in the middle of nature, surrounded by crops and animals - hens, frogs and dogs (which can be a bit nosy at night and very early morning). The staff was super warm and welcoming, notably Mr. Dann (the manager) who was particularly friendly.

I would like to thanks Dan’s Team for their kind welcoming. We spent 3 days in the lodge and we truly appreciated their services. The food was amazing as well as all the support they provided during our journey. I truly recommend this place. It is beautiful place to stay surrounded with nature and local people. Thanks again and I hope to come back one day ☺️

Me and my friend only spent one night at this place as we arrived back from Y Ty . We really needed somewhere comfortable to relax and this lodge had just that ! The brooms are very comfortable and the bed is heavenly ! Nothing was too much of a a problem when asking questions and the front desk guy was so kind and friendly , he was always with kindness and happy to help where possible ! Quiet area if you want to relax ! They also have food available which is great so you don’t have to leave the Homestay to find food !

Really lovely homestay. We contacted them on whatsapp before to get picked up from our bus stop - just before you get into sapa. We were early but they were quick at replying so they sent a car for us straight away. Feels really peaceful and quiet there and the beds are really comfy. Breakfast was nice, I had banana pancakes and my partner had an omelette.

The view from the rooms was amazing. However, we got a lot of bugs in our room in the evening, despite keeping the doors and windows shut. We wore bug spray and it seemed to be fine.

Only thing I would say to be aware of is that it’s a 20 minute drive from Sapa and you have to get a taxi. Going into the town the homestay calls a lady to drive you and she charges 250,000 dong (quite a lot!). Coming back from Sapa to the homestay, we got a taxi on the meter for 200,000 dong, so slightly better. However, we ended up going in and out of town twice over the course of our stay so the cost of taxis really adds up. We spent more on taxis than the actual homestay itself!

The night was mostly very peaceful, but as you are in a village there are a lot of dogs so you can hear quite a bit of barking - as soon as one barks it riles them all up 😂 There was a thunderstorm when we stayed so every time there was any thunder it really got them going!

Hey hey follow my Instagram to make friend : bryankow0608 ✌️ If you love my sharing, you can follow me on Google Account too 🥰

I’m Malaysian who love Vietnam very much. I would love to share more amazing place to visits in Vietnam and give my honour review in Google. Peace 🫶

Disclaimer : this is not a paid post. I would just share my real review. 😉

Beautiful view. Customer service, not so great. We’re the only customer at the time. We were wondering why no one came to check on us to see if we wanted anything else. Came to see that all 4 staff members were busy on their phones. Even when we walked down to go pay standing right in front of them, they were still on their phones. We vocalized that we wanted to pay. It took a few seconds before the lady behind the bar perked up and said “oh!” And gave us our receipt.
Favorite place in Sa Pa so far. Beautiful views, restraunt and atmosphere. Service is top notch. Drinks and food are good, and reasonably priced.
Decent bar with a view of the lake with very loud 80s renditions.

Positives. Pleasant staff, good view.
Negatives. Very expensive(expected given view  point), Ordinary furnishing,  trying hard to be cool with flashing lights and doesn't accept card for payment which is crazy as some things are worth a small fortune!

data.formatted_address: Nhà hàng ăn uống, 24 Đ. Đông Lợi, TT. Sa Pa, Sa Pa, Lào Cai 333101, Vietnam
