reviews.text: FOOD POISONING!!! FOOD POISONING! The only food we consumed on this day was from this restaurant and the proceeding hours and days were full of vomiting etc. The RESTAURANT DID  NOTHING to assist with a refund for the sickness they caused and the inconvenience on our holiday. NEGATIVE stars if I could

Order fried noodles too.
Maybe the Food is not at its best during off peak due to the chef not being on duty. But the staff service and the atmosphere is good.
I had my egg coffee here. It tastes different though compared to the egg coffee in Hanoi. It’s a nice restaurant with good interior. A fine dink g restaurant.

Their interior are very nice and got very nice view of mountain..
Staff are very friendly and nice
In sapa they are many western food restaurants you could find and the taste will be moderate  but this one restaurants food really good and the price for main course around 200,000 to 400,000 dong.

I think we caught the chefs between shifts because the food was really poor.  Stir-fried noodles were instant noodles with onions and dodgy chicken.  Grilled Surgeon truly bad, may have been microwaved.  Bar staff were nice but I sense there was no Chef on duty

data.formatted_address: 22°17'48.4"N 103°53'28.2"E, Tả Van, Sa Pa, Lào Cai 330000, Vietnam
data.name: Dinh SaPa Trekking Adventures

reviews.text: Staying with Dinh and her family for three days was an unforgettable experience! Beyond the incredible treks that showcase the stunning beauty of the area, what truly sets this experience apart is Dinh's remarkable personality. She's not just always cheerful and eager to welcome new guests; Dinh is also deeply committed to improving the lives of the local community. Her efforts to enhance the living conditions for children and women who lack access to basic necessities like water and electricity, and who are isolated from the rest of the valley, are truly commendable. We felt right at home with her hospitality and were inspired by her dedication to making a difference. We highly recommend her services to anyone looking for an authentic and enriching adventure. Can't wait to return!

We spent a wonderful day trekking with Dinh. My only regret is we didn’t stay longer. As we were already staying in Tavan, she met us there and welcomed us into her beautiful homestay - perched on the top of the hill with the most incredible view over the rice fields and valley. We spent the morning walking on very quiet tracks, crossing streams, navigating narrow rice field paths, en route to Lao Cai. She looked after our two daughters (7 and 9) incredibly well, even piggybacking them at times! She educated us on the Hmong people and the other ethnic minorities in the area, their clothing, agricultural practices, their traditions and way of life. We were happy to learn of her story - how much she has overcome - and her truly inspirational ambition. She’s a change maker and supporting her has a beautiful multiplier effect given her focus on helping kids in her community and being a beacon for change and hope. The walk back along the river and journey to the rock were fun! Wishing you well Dinh - happy to highly recommend you to anyone we meet keen to visit the real Sapa! We are so glad other travellers told us about you 🥰

We did the trekking with Dinh and stayed one night with her and her family. Apart from her being an incredible guide with very good english, she’s an amazing person who, with the money raised, helps the local Black Hmong community, specially by improving the living conditions and life opportunities of the children, helping them to have an education. By staying with her, not only will you stay in her beautiful homestay, eat sooo good food and have the best and most commited guide, but also will be part of an amazing project 💛

This is a must do if you’re visiting sapa, Dinh and her family are incredibly accommodating and show you some truly amazing sights along the treks. She is so kind and has such a positive attitude it made our experience so lovely. Her story is both heart breaking and inspiring and should be heard by as many people as possible.

I did the 2 days 1 night trekking with Dinh and it was the best, she is wonderful local guide from the Black Hmong ethnic minority, we spent the night at her home in the village, where I had the opportunity to meet and play with the local children she’s supporting to go to school. It was touching to see how Dinh, who hot an opportunity when a traveler visited her village and managed to help her to study, decided to do the same for other children, with the hope to change  the history of many families in the region. Highly recommend for those seeking an authentic and meaningful experience in Sapa. Besides enjoying the local beauty, you help the community, which makes the experience even more special

data.formatted_address: 9Q3F+5X2, QL4D, San Sả Hồ, Sa Pa, Lào Cai, Vietnam
data.name: Fansipan Canyoning

reviews.text:
Very nice and breathtaking view at the peak of Fansipan. The weather was so cold and breezy up here, but the view of canyons also the status of Budha here was very beautiful.

There’s often fogs, but we can still enjoy the view. So many stairs, but we also have options to get the train to go up and down from Cable Car area. The cost for train is 150.000 VND going up and 120.000 VND going down.

The view of some spots can only be enjoyed by walking down the stairs, like the statue Budha, nine waterfalls, also the temples.

At the peak, we can take a picture with the Vietnam flag, with the view of great mountains. Very beautiful and worth it.

A new type of tourism appears in the most wonderful nature reserve in Vietnam with the roof of Indochina and the romantic waterfall of love, taking us from the peak, immersing ourselves in the water mist and immersing ourselves. The waters converge with countless cool and cold feelings of temperate and tropical climate. Finally, you follow the golden stream and dreamily feel the parting and attachment before leaving the magical natural forest. There is no place more beautiful and poetic than the waterfall of love and can only feel all the beauty, charm mixed with suspense and vibration through Canyoning tour activities!
They straight up try to scam you at this place
I'm really impressed with this journey, it's crazy and memorable! I wish I could return to the wild friends there soon
This tour is very new and very wonderful

data.formatted_address: TL152, Lao Chải, Sa Pa, Lào Cai 31706 Sapa, Lao Chải, Sa Pa, Lào Cai 330000, Vietnam
data.name: Sapa Trekking Adventures

reviews.text:
Ha was a great guide - we enjoyed our half day trek from Sapa Town to the village of Lao Chai. Even though it was misty on the hill, the valley was clear enough to be enjoyable.

In the winter months, trail will be muddy, so be prepared to need a change of clothes at the end!

Also, expect that there will be some local women who follow you up to the lunch spot, and they will strongly encourage you to buy some handicrafts. Can treat it as a tip - they were really helpful throughout the challenging terrain.
Wonderful place!!! Ha is such a lovely lady and she is so funny. But above all, she’s an awesome Tourguide. We had a great time trekking with her. Highly recommended!

Amazing experience in Sapa with Ha! The homestay was clean and authentically charming, and the food was delightful. We enjoyed beautiful hikes around the rice terraces, exploring less touristy routes. Ha paid attention to every detail, from booking a hotel upon our morning arrival from Hanoi to providing typical snacks along the road and handcrafted souvenirs made with local materials during the hikes. Thank you so much, Ha, for your meticulous care !

Ha is a wonderful person. She leads people through the hills of Sapa with so much knowledge and love that there is no way but loving her and Sapa. She is full of energy and always friendly with a smile on her face.  I can highly recommend going on a trekking adventure with Ha. It is honestly a lovely adventure. Thank you

data.formatted_address: Unnamed Road, Bản Hồ, Sa Pa, Lào Cai, Vietnam
data.name: Thác Utopia ( Thác hoang sơ )

reviews.text: Beautiful place without people. This is rare for Sapa. Quite village. Road was hard, but it is part of adventure!
The view is just  ok.....It's not difficult hiking .....but easily got lost.... can't arrive by moto bike....the water fall water is not good....so sadly ...
It's hard to find the way to here but it's so worth

Great!
When people finish visiting this place, they visit people's houses and ask them to cook sturgeon, salmon, etc. This creates more income for the people here!
The road to get in is quite difficult, so you should walk in, motorbikes are for those with strong driving skills, the name of the waterfall is misnamed on the map.

data.formatted_address: Ta Van, Sa Pa, Lao Cai 330000, Vietnam
data.name: Phung Trekking sapa

reviews.text: Had a great experience with motor bike tour around Sapa, O Quy Ho Pass and Lao Cai, with Phung being my tour guide. Quite reliable and very good driver. He’s well experience with what he’s doing and very professional. Thank you, Phung. 👍

Unbelievable day of trekking with Phung and his team. We went up and down in one day, it was very hard but well worth it for the views - plus you can get the gondola if you want to, there is no need to walk down. There are other options, e.g. 2D 1N, so you can go up for sunrise.
Everything we needed was provided, including hotel pickup, water, a lovely lunch, and all fees for entry into the national park.
A very professional service provided by Phung and his team and I would recommend to anyone who would like to do the trek! 10/10, thank you Phung and team!
Most stunning hike above the clouds. Proper slog too with 1600m elevation gain, 9 hours moving time and 21km there and back. Phung was an excellent guide. Highly recommended!
Trekking with Phung was a pleasure, he was a great guide who answered any questions and talked with us whenever we wanted. If I ever did it again I would gladly book with him again!

What a great day hiking up Fansipan with Phung. We did the hike in a day, what a superb day and can highly recommend. Lunch was included at the top too plus water. He answered all our questions and knows the route inside out, he can go at any speed you require too. We were lucky as the cable car was shut for a month so only a few hikers were at the top of the mountain.

data.formatted_address: Số 79 đường Nguyễn Chí Thanh, TT. Sa Pa, Sa Pa, Lào Cai 333311, Vietnam
data.name: ETHOS - Spirit of the Community

reviews.text:
AMAZING!!! Cannot recommend ETHOS enough. We did a 1 day tour to a hmong village and lunch with a local family (Simply Hmong Tour). From the beginning, right to the very end… the whole tour was fantastic! We started off with an informal conversation and learned so much about the Hmong and Zhao culture. Then we partnered with our guide, Ker, who took us on a trek to the village. The views were stunning, weaving up and down through the rice patty fields. The lunch was fantastic. We got to interact with the Hmong family with Ker as our translator. We helped with some preparation of the food… and the spring rolls that we helped make were the best we’ve ever had!

Ker was such a fantastic guide, she was exceedingly kind, patient with our slow walking, answered all our questions and even shared some hilarious stories with us about her childhood. She gave us great insight into their way of life and it’s an experience we will never forget. Highly recommended!!!

Definitely recommend, absolutely exceptional! I had one of the best experiences with Ethos during my whole trip to Vietnam. They really care about the local people and offer what no other company does (although they all for sure promise, cause business...) - experiencing the real daily lives, understanding the community and not touristy nature.

Hoa, Phil and others really put their hearts into the community and the programs they offer. This is the true experience and insight into the lives of local ethnics you can get in Sapa, led by local guides and all profit staying really with the local people, helping many families. They gave us detailed historical background of the region, current life and issues, we also had a chance to talk with local guides and they answered all of our questions.

I went on a short trek and an amazing incredible lunch with a local Hmong family with my lovely local guide My. She was very nice, we talked a lot, My also showed me and explained how to make indigo (it's a real science!). I was alone at this experience, I had all the time that I wanted to spend with the family, discuss the length of trek, have many stops to take pictures on my camera. For the first time on a guided tour, I didn't feel rushed at all! I loved it.

They also run a lot of programs supporting kids, women, providing better life quality, educational programs. After the trip, I spent few more hours with Hoa and Phil in their home. I felt extremely welcomed and when I'm back again, I'll definitely spend more time here with them 💜

I can't stress enough how amazing this company is! Returning to Sa Pa for the second time, I was blown away by the incredible experience they provided. From start to finish, everyone involved in the trip was exceptional. Cha and Ker are not only incredibly kind, but they also went above and beyond to ensure my journey was unforgettable. And then there's Phil - a fascinating individual making a real difference in the local community. I'm already itching to return and book another tour with them. If you want an authentic local experience, this is the company you need to choose. Thank you for everything!

This has been easily the best thing I've done in Vietnam, after 3 trips and over 4 months time spent in this wonderful country. I cannot recommend highly enough!
Ethos has the most lovely team of people, who are truly trying to do ethical tourism right. With this you can contribute directly to marginalised communities, and have a significant positive impact.

My partner and I did the batik workshop with My, and a 2 day 1 night homestay and trekking experince to Ta Phin with May Lai.

My was very patient and knowledgeable about the whole process of making the batik, from growing the hemp, to spinning and weaving it, and we got a wonderful full day of hands-on making for creating our patterns, before the fabric being taken and dyed over several days with natural indigo dye in the traditional way. The dyed and finished batik piece was mailed to us afterwards (which was very appreciated, as we forgot to take them with us).
The amazing team at ethos provided the most delicious enormous lunch spread, easily accomodating vego/vegan and including some of the most delicious food I've had in Vietnam. They also always provided us with tea, coffee and fruit, anytime we dropped into the space, it was always really great coffee too!

May Lai is such a kind and calm person to trek with, she totally tailors the experience to you, you can be as physically intense or as laidback as you like with the walking, and the scenery was unreal. Beautiful rice terraces, bamboo forests and tiny villages. People you come across are curious and friendly, when you smile or nod at them their faces light up.
We loved learning about the local plants from May Lai, which berries we can eat, which leaves are used for indigo dye, and more.
We saw no other foreigners the entire time. May Lai was so generous with letting us into her home and meeting her family, from having delicious lunch with her mum and cousins to staying the night in her lovely traditional wooden home and spending time with her curious and excitable daughter and shy and sweet son. The home cooked meals we had during this tour were all wonderful and my partner still finds herself thinking about them. We also had the special opportunity to buy some beautiful 2nd hand textiles handmade by her mother in years past. I cant wait to come back, and we will want stay so much longer next time!

We did a two-days one-night trekking, and we will forever remember this as the highlight of our 2-weeks trip in Vietnam. All people at Ethos speak fluent English, including our guide My, and this was essential to get the most out of the experience. They are local Hmongs, so they could explain every little detail we were interested about, from their culture to management of the rice fields. The landscapes we went through were stunning, and there were no other tourists besides us. Every local family we visited during the hike has been incredibly kind and welcoming to us. We really experienced their everyday life in their own homes. The food was amazing, the best of our whole travel. We cooked together, including wild vegetables harvested along the way, and we made spring rolls. Way over our expectations. The price it is absolutely worth for such a unique experience. Furthermore, their work supports directly the local communities, which is extremely valuable. We will definitely recommend it to our friends.
Thanks so much for everything.
Mattia & Michela
